newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins edge up on FOMC optimism.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins edge up on FOMC optimism.

text.p: MinFin bonds edged up on Thursday, echoing Western optimism after a U.S. Federal Open Market Committee decision not to change its rates last week, dealers said.
"The trend of small growth is continuing with tiny corrections during the day, mainly on Western demand," said a dealer with a major bank.
He said the recent FOMC decision not to change its rates was still affecting the market.
"Investors have defined their priorities and are now forming their portfolios," he said.
He said there was a shortage of paper and most demand in tranche 3, 6 and 7.
The market lost some steam in the evening as prices stabilized and no clear direction emerged, an International Moscow Bank dealer said.
He said he saw narrowing spreads and a lot of choices, which meant the future trend was unclear.
He said the market was resting after a strong rise of about 0.5 percent on Wednesday.

The other dealer forecast a further price rise with periodical corrections on hopes about Russia's second Eurobond issue planned for March and the closing of the London club re-scheduling at the end of March or start of April.
